basics.name: Yu Otsubo (大坪 悠)
basics.label: AI Development Lead / Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software and Infrastructure developer with 9+ years of experience, currently leading engineering teams with a focus on generative AI and AI agent development. AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional with deep expertise in serverless architecture and production-level AI systems. Published 3 technical books in 2025 on MCP and AI agents. Led development of A-BOSS, a production AI agent serving 700+ users at KDDI. Camera and music-loving web developer who is also an amateur DTM composer and guitarist. Active open source contributor with 190+ GitHub repositories.

work.summary: Leading generative AI application development with focus on AI agents. Development lead for A-BOSS (AI Business Department Manager) serving 700+ users. Published 3 technical books in 2025. Contributing to AWS Japan Official Blog and providing training as KAGAI Learning Hub instructor.
highlights: Development lead for A-BOSS - AI agent for KDDI corporate sales, serving 700+ users with 10 hours/month efficiency gain per user
Built 議事録パックン (Minutes Pakkun) - comprehensive sales support tool with meeting transcription and proposal generation
Deployed かぐたん (Kagutan) - secure internal AI chatbot to 1,200 users across 4 companies with ~2,000 monthly requests
Co-authored 3 technical books: 'やさしいMCP入門', 'AIエージェント開発/運用入門', and 'KAG Tech Book Vol.1'
Featured in AWS Japan Official Blog for A-BOSS case study
Instructor at KAGAI Learning Hub for GenAI and AI agent training
Active speaker at technical conferences including NW-JAWS and Langfuse Night
Currently on parental leave (Sep 2025 - Apr 2026) while continuing technical activities

work.summary: As an SRE Engineer, improved continuous development processes using AWS CDK, GitHub Actions, and Autify.
highlights: Built and improved CI/CD pipeline and infrastructure on AWS
Migrated services from EC2 to ECS/Fargate with Blue/Green deployment
Expanded automated testing using Autify and developed execution pipeline for QA efficiency

work.summary: Full-cycle engineer for Web-based event matching platform using AWS, Nest.js, and React with TypeScript. Development Manager for Product Infrastructure team.
highlights: Developed pseudo-live function for pre-recorded video live streaming
Built video distribution platform and API infrastructure for external collaboration
Developed public API platform and MA/SFA integration (Marketo/Salesforce connectors)
Created Data Clean Room with Snowflake and AWS
Led Product Infrastructure team mission formulation and execution
Accelerated CI/CD and maintained E2E tests for engineering team support
Introduced FaaS migration and Blue/Green deployment

work.summary: Tech Lead and AWS architect for Web-based and Native App chatbot services. Led team of 8-10 members with responsibilities spanning architecture, development, team management, and stakeholder negotiation.
highlights: Architecture featured at AWS Summit Tokyo 2019

work.summary: Developed data analysis infrastructure for chatbot conversation analysis. Implemented Data-lake architecture with serverless Lambda Python and Pandas.
Developed and operated Web-based chatbot services using AWS, Python, and Node.js. Architecture featured ECS with Docker, DynamoDB, Lambda, and S3.
highlights: First experience using Python and Node.js
Lectured at AWS Summit Tokyo 2019 company booth

work.summary: Led analytics operation system development using Splunk and Hadoop (MapR) for internal log analysis.
highlights: Big data handling with Splunk and Hadoop (MapR)

work.summary: Developed and operated location-based services using on-premise servers. Built integrated monitoring system with Zabbix.
highlights: Integrated monitoring system with Zabbix and Expect automation

volunteer.summary: Active participant in Japanese Langfuse community, sharing LLMOps knowledge and best practices.
highlights: Speaker at Langfuse Night #1 (Nov 2024): 'Langfuse v3 使ってますか?'
Developed langfuse-v3-terraform module for AWS deployment
Published blog posts on cost-effective Langfuse operation

volunteer.summary: Providing enterprise training on generative AI and AI agent development.
highlights: Corporate training on GenAI application development
AI agent architecture and LLMOps workshops

volunteer.summary: Maintaining 190+ public repositories with focus on developer productivity tools and AI agent ecosystem.
highlights: Created midi-mcp-server (16 stars) - MCP server for MIDI generation
Developed mcp-prompts - MCP server for prompt template management
Built langfuse-v3-terraform - Terraform module for Langfuse v3 on AWS
Maintained portfolio and blog sites with 100% Lighthouse scores
Created developer tools: ebook_homebrew, update_release, npm_profile_card

awards.title: AWS Summit Tokyo 2019 - Featured Speaker
awards.summary: Lectured at company booth on chatbot architecture using AWS services. Presented serverless architecture with ECS, DynamoDB, and Lambda.

awards.title: KDDI-BX Project Achievement
awards.summary: A-BOSS project contributed to 46,939 hours/year saved across KDDI-BX initiative. Generated 10 hours/month efficiency per user for 700+ sales staff.

awards.title: Award of Technology Quality Improvement
awards.summary: Stable and flexible system design utilizing AWS and successfully responded to large-scale traffic without problems.

publications.name: やさしいMCP入門 (Gentle Introduction to MCP)
publications.summary: Co-authored with Minoru Onda. Introduction to Model Context Protocol (MCP), the new standard for AI agent era. Based on popular slides, explains fundamentals accessible to both engineers and non-engineers. Covers MCP architecture, hands-on tutorials, client/server applications, and business impact. Reprinted within 2 months due to strong reception. 160 pages, A5 format.

publications.name: AIエージェント開発/運用入門 [生成AI深掘りガイド] (AI Agent Development/Operations Guide)
publications.summary: Co-authored with Minoru Onda and Masaki Tsukada. Comprehensive guide covering AI agent fundamentals to implementation and LLMOps. Includes complete implementation examples from simple reasoning agents to MCP-based and multi-agent systems. Covers LangChain, LangGraph, Mastra, Amazon Bedrock, Langfuse, and Guardrails. Features full-color illustrations and extensive hands-on exercises. Launch event held on release date. 408 pages.

publications.name: KAG Tech Book -Vol1-
publications.summary: Technical anthology by KDDI Agile Development Center engineers. Contributed chapter on 'Celery in Detail' - comprehensive guide to Python distributed task queue library including operational considerations and AWS scaling practices. Published at Gijutsushoten 18 (Tech Book Festival 18).

projects.name: A-BOSS (AI Business Department Manager)
projects.description: Production AI agent serving as a virtual department manager for KDDI corporate sales. Provides executive-level expertise for proposal reviews and strategic guidance. Features faithful replication of real executive's thinking patterns, personality, and speaking style (including Kansai dialect). Built on Amazon Bedrock with Agentic Workflow using ReAct pattern.
highlights: Serving 700+ KDDI corporate sales staff in production
Achieves 10 hours/month efficiency gain per user
Reduced proposal creation time by up to 1 hour
Contributes to KDDI-BX initiative (46,939 hours/year saved company-wide)
Featured in AWS Japan Official Blog and multiple media outlets (Nikkei, Business Insider Japan)
Automatic user feedback summarization and reflection

projects.name: 議事録パックン (Minutes Pakkun)
projects.description: Comprehensive sales support tool covering the full cycle: meeting transcription → proposal creation → knowledge sharing. Automatically generates meeting minutes from audio/video, creates proposal drafts, searches internal product information, generates competitor comparison tables, and creates daily/weekly reports.
highlights: Saves up to 1 hour per meeting

projects.name: かぐたん (Kagutan) - Secure Internal AI Chatbot
projects.description: Secure internal generative AI chatbot deployed across KDDI Digital Divergence Holdings group companies. Provides safe AI chat capabilities with complete conversation logging and multi-tenant support. Passed internal security audit.
highlights: Passed internal audit for security compliance
Slack Socket Mode for secure communication

projects.name: midi-mcp-server
projects.description: Model Context Protocol server for MIDI generation. Enables AI agents to create MIDI files programmatically through standardized protocol interface.

projects.name: mcp-prompts
projects.description: MCP server for prompt template management. Provides dynamic template loading and resource management for AI agent systems.

projects.name: langfuse-v3-terraform
projects.description: Terraform module for deploying Langfuse v3 on AWS. Enables cost-effective LLMOps infrastructure setup with best practices.

projects.name: Portfolio Website
projects.description: Personal portfolio website built with modern web technologies. Achieved 100% Lighthouse score across all categories (Performance, Accessibility, Best Practices, SEO). All photography by the author.

projects.name: Technical Blog
projects.description: Technical blog built with Gatsby v4, Preact, and TypeScript. Features PWA, Algolia search, and maintains 100% Lighthouse score. Covers topics in AI, AWS, DevOps, and full-stack development.
highlights: Regular technical articles on AI, AWS, and development practices

projects.name: The Chatbot Service for Customer Support (Web)
projects.description: Hybrid architecture chatbot combining AI and human operators for telecommunications customer support. Achieved high FAQ response rate using Elasticsearch as search engine.
highlights: Hybrid architecture with chatbot and human operators
Labor saving and improved customer satisfaction
Roles: Primary Developer, Data Scientist, Scrum Master

projects.name: The Chatbot Service for Customer Support (Native Apps)
projects.description: Enhanced chatbot service for Android and iOS customer support apps. Microarchitecture using Node.js for BFF with WebSocket, Python for backend. Architecture featured at AWS Summit Tokyo 2019.
highlights: Native app chatbot for Android and iOS

meta.note: Updated with comprehensive research data as of November 2025. Currently on parental leave (Sep 2025 - Apr 2026) while continuing technical activities including book publications and open source contributions.
